en.page-heading: Text format for satellite spectrum licence site data upload
en.page-description: Learn about the format, validation rules, and errors when uploading spectrum licence site data.

TR1.description: Enter the number of your spectrum licence.
TR1.format-rules:
• Must belong to an account in your web profile
  • Must be a granted (paid) spectrum licence, and not expired
  • Must be exactly 9 digits long including leading zeroes as necessary
  • Do not include the licence version number
TR1.error-description: The licence number does not contain a leading 0, the licence number does not belong to your account, the licence number is not in Granted status, or the licence is expired.

TR2.description: Optional field to enter a reference name for your site.

TR3.description: Name of the person who may be contacted.
TR3.error-description: The Contact Name is missing or exceeds the character limit.

TR4.description: Enter the telephone number of the person who may be contacted.
TR4.format-rules:
• Minimum length of 10 characters
  • Maximum length of 254 characters
TR4.error-description: The Business Telephone Number is missing or exceeds the character limit.

TR5.description: Enter the email address of the person who may be contacted.
TR5.format-rules:
• Maximum length 254 characters
  • For multiplate email addresses, separate them with commas
TR5.error-description: The E-mail Address is missing or exceeds the character limit.

TR6.description: Enter the station is located or specify if there are no changes or no stations.
TR6.format-rules:
If you currently have a station
If you currently have a station deployed, enter the location of your station (Maximum length of 63 characters).

If you have no changes to stations
If you have no changes to your station information, enter “NOCHANGES” and leave columns G to BB empty.

If you have no stations deployed
If you have no station deployed or being decommissioned, enter “NOSTATIONS” and leave columns G to BB empty
TR6.error-description: The Station Location is missing or exceeds the character limit.
TR6.note:
An error in this field may also introduce errors in the following fields:
  • L – Latitude
  • M – Longitude
  • AD – Download resource allocation

TR7.error-description: The Station Type is not input as CAPS, is missing or is not an accepted Station Type value.

TR8.description: The mode of operation (provisioning) for the radio apparatus at the site.
TR8.error-description: The Radio Technology value is missing, not in ALL CAPS, or not one of the allowed values.

TR9.description: The mobile network Cell Global Identity (CGI) following the 3GPP notation for the given radio technology.
TR9.required-when:
This field is required when H - Radio technology is any of the following:
  • GSM
  • CDMA
  • HSPA
  • LTE
  • 5GNR
  • 5GDSS
TR9.format-rules:
For GSM, CDMA, HSPA
(CGI): PLMN-LAC-CID

For 5GNR, 5GDSS
(NCGI): PLMN-TAC-NCI

For LTE
(ECGI): PLMN-TAC-ECI
  • Must be in the format of 999999-99999999-99999999999
  • Minimum of 11 characters
  • Maximum of 27 characters
TR9.error-description: The Cell ID is missing or not in the expected format or length.

TR10.description: The filter codes for earth stations operating in the band 3700-4200 MHz.
TR10.required-when:
This field is required only when H - Radio technology is any of the following:
  • LTE
  • 5GNR
  • 5GDSS
TR10.format-rules:
Must be one of the following filter codes:

  • 0 – Non-Transitioned
  • 1 – Transitioned
  • 2 – New
TR10.error-description: Earth station filter code is missing or not within the expected range of values.

TR11.description: Enter the two-character abbreviation of the province or territory your station is located in.
TR11.format-rules:
Your licence coordinates must be within the province or territory

Must be one of the following provincial or territorial codes:

  • AB - Alberta
  • BC - British Columbia
  • MB - Manitoba
  • NB - New Brunswick
  • NL- Newfoundland and Labrador
  • NS - Nova Scotia
  • ON - Ontario
  • PE - Prince Edward Island
  • QC - Quebec
  • SK - Saskatchewan
  • NT - Northwest Territories
  • NU - Nunavut
  • YT - Yukon
For transportable stations, includes "IP" for interprovincial and "CA" for Canada-wide.)
TR11.error-description: The Province/Territory is not input as CAPS, is missing or is not an accepted Province/Territory abbreviation.

TR12.description: Enter the latitudinal coordinate of the station.
TR12.format-rules:
• Must be in decimal degrees using the WGS84 format
  • Must be a location within the licence area
  • Must be between 41 to 90
  • A minimum of four decimal places may be entered if coordinates are not exact
  • A maximum of seven decimal places
TR12.error-description: The Latitude is missing or not within the expected range. The site coordinates may not fall within the licensed service area.

TR13.description: Enter the longitudinal coordinates of the station.
TR13.format-rules:
• Must be in decimal degrees using the WGS84 format
  • Must be a location within the licence area
  • Must be between -141 to -40
  • A minimum of four decimal places may be entered if coordinates are not exact
  • A maximum of seven decimal places
TR13.error-description: The Longitude is missing or not within the expected range (use negative to indicate degrees west). The site coordinates may not fall within the licensed service area.

TR14.description: The general type of site associated with the installation.
TR14.error-description: The Site Type Code is not input as CAPS, is missing or is not an accepted Site Type Code value.

TR15.description: The total height (m) above ground level of an outdoor structure where antennas are mounted. This structure might also be shared with other radio installations (ex: towers, rooftops, etc).
TR15.required-when: This field is required only when N - Site type code is O.
TR15.format-rules:
• Must be greater than the antenna height
  • Must be between 1 to 600 m
  • For equipment mounted on top of a building or its boundaries, add together the total height of the building and the antenna’s supporting structure.
TR15.error-description: The Structure Height is missing or not within the expected range of values.
TR15.note:
An error in this field may also give errors in the following fields:
  • AM - Tx Antenna Height
  • AN - Rx Antenna Height

TR16.description: The type of structure in use at the site.
TR16.format-rules:
Must be one of the following structure types:
  • T - Purpose-built tower
  • R - Outside of building or rooftop
  • P - Light pole, other street electrical, or utility pole
  • S - Water tower or farm silo
  • F - Furniture
  • M - Transportable (Report the current operating location only and not the radius of operation)
  • O - Other (E.g. indoor)
TR16.error-description: The Structure Type Code is not input as CAPS, is missing or is not an accepted Structure Type Code value.

TR17.description: The date that the installation went into service. This date helps investigate possible sources of technical issues.
TR17.format-rules:
• Must be a date in the past
  • Must be in the format of YYYY-MM-DD
TR17.error-description: The date is missing or not in the expected format or range.
TR17.note:
ORA-01841: (full) year must be between -4713 and +9999, and not be 0

If you have an improper date format, other errors may not be shown.

TR18.description: The identifier as defined by the licensee for the site or antenna installation.
TR18.format-rules: (Note that it is not validated to be unique)
TR18.error-description: The Site Record ID is missing.

TR19.description: The centre frequency (MHz) of the occupied bandwidth as well as any installations that are used unidirectionally for transmission or reception only.
TR19.format-rules:
• If your antenna is receive only and not transmitting enter 0
  • Must be within an authorized frequency band for this licence
  • Must be the centre frequency
TR19.error-description: The Tx Channel Frequency is missing or not within an authorized frequency band for this licence.

TR20.description: The centre frequency (MHz) of the occupied bandwidth for the given antenna installation, as well as any installations that are used unidirectionally for transmission or reception only.
TR20.format-rules:
• Must be within an authorized frequency band for this licence
  • Must be the centre frequency
  • If your antenna is transmit only and not receiving enter 0
TR20.error-description: The Rx Channel Frequency is missing or not within an authorized frequency band for this licence.

TR21.description: The transmitting radio’s Hardware Version Identification Number (HVIN) certified by ISED.
TR21.required-when: This field is required when S - Tx channel frequency is greater than 0.
TR21.format-rules:
• Maximum length 128 characters
  • If the radio is certification-exempt, you must provide the manufacturer's radio model number or a system configuration name
TR21.error-description: The Tx Radio HVIN is missing or exceeds the character limit.

TR22.description: The receiving radio’s Hardware Version Identification Number (HVIN) certified by ISED. If the radio is certification-exempt, please provide the manufacturer's radio model number or a system configuration name.
TR22.required-when: This field is required when T - Rx channel frequency is greater than 0.
TR22.format-rules:
• Maximum length 128 characters
  • If the radio is certification-exempt, you must provide the manufacturer's radio model number or a system configuration name
TR22.error-description: The Rx Radio HVIN is missing or exceeds the character limit.

TR23.description: The company code assigned by ISED’s Certification and Engineering Bureau (CEB) to the manufacturer of the radio transmitter.
TR23.error-description: The Tx Radio Manufacturer Code is missing or is not an accepted Manufacturer Code value.

TR24.description: The company code assigned by ISED’s Certification and Engineering Bureau (CEB) to the manufacturer of the radio receiver.
TR24.error-description: The Rx Radio Manufacturer Code is missing or is not an accepted Manufacturer Code value.

TR25.description: The Certification Number assigned by ISED to the radio transmitter and listed in the Radio Equipment List (REL).
TR25.error-description: The Tx Radio Certification Number is missing or exceeds the character limit.

TR26.description: The Certification Number assigned by ISED to the radio receiver and listed in the Radio Equipment List (REL).
TR26.error-description: The Rx Radio Certification Number is missing or exceeds the character limit.

TR27.description: The occupied bandwidth (KHz) of the emission (Transmit) signal. It corresponds to the bandwidth containing 99% of the transmitted power.
TR27.error-description: The Bandwidth is missing or not within the expected range.

TR28.description: The International Telecommunication Union (ITU) designation for the class of emission.
TR28.format-rules:
• Must be a valid emission code as described in Valid Class of Emission Codes.
  • Enter the emission class that uses the largest bandwidth
TR28.error-description: The Class of Emission is missing or not in the expected format or length.

TR29.description:
The Total Radiated Power (TRP) or Total Conducted Power (TCP) in dBm.

Ensure the value entered is expressed in dBm. Wrong units will cause incorrect representation of power levels, and may be flagged for suspected non-compliance.
TR29.required-when: This field is required when S - Tx channel frequency is greater than 0.
TR29.format-rules:
Must be one of the following:
  • Enter TRP for AAS equipment (as defined in the applicable SRSP)
  • Enter TCP for non-AAS equipment
TR29.error-description: The Transmitter TCP or TRP is missing, or not within the expected range.

TR30.format-rules:
• For bidirectional systems that transmit and receive on the same frequency (TDD), enter the percentage of time transmitting (see GL-01) from 1 to 99.
  • For full duplex systems, enter 100.
TR30.error-description: The Downlink Resource Allocation is missing or not within the expected range.

TR31.description: The type of antenna associated with a transmitting radio installation.
TR31.required-when: This field is required when G - Station type is FX and S - Tx channel frequency is greater than 0.
TR31.format-rules:
Entry must be one of the following:
  • AAS – Active antenna systems
  • NAC – Non-AAS correlated
  • NAU – Non-ASS uncorrelated

If deploying a hybrid mode, enter NAC.
TR31.error-description: The Tx Antenna Type Code is not input as CAPS, is missing or is not an accepted Antenna Type Code value.

TR32.description: The type of antenna associated with a receiving radio installation.
TR32.required-when: This field is required when G - Station type is FX and T - Rx channel frequency is greater than 0.
TR32.format-rules:
Entry must be one of the following:
  • AAS – Active antenna systems
  • NAC – Non-AAS correlated
  • NAU – Non-ASS uncorrelated

If deploying a hybrid mode, enter NAC.
TR32.error-description: The Rx Antenna Type Code is not input as CAPS, is missing or is not an accepted Antenna Type Code value.

TR33.description: The total number of Tx antennas.
TR33.required-when: This field is required when T - Rx channel frequency is greater than 0.
TR33.format-rules:
• For a single-input and single-output (SISO) system enter 1
  • For a traditional antenna diversity enter 2 or any numbes greater
  • For MIMO systems, enter the number of antenna elements in the antenna panel
TR33.error-description: The Number of Tx Antennas is missing or not within the expected range.

TR34.description: The total number of Rx antennas.
TR34.required-when: This field is required when T - Rx channel frequency is greater than 0.
TR34.format-rules:
• For a single-input and single-output (SISO) system enter 1
  • For a traditional antenna diversity enter 2 or any numbes greater
  • For MIMO systems, enter the number of antenna elements in the antenna panel
TR34.error-description: The Number of Rx Antennas is missing or not within the expected range.

TR35.description: The model number of the transmitter antenna.
TR35.required-when: This field is required when S - Tx channel frequency is greater than 0.
TR35.error-description: The Tx Antenna Model Number is missing or exceeds the character limit.

TR36.description: The model number of the receiver antenna.
TR36.required-when: This field is required when T - Rx channel frequency is greater than 0.
TR36.error-description: The Rx Antenna Model Number is missing or exceeds the character limit.

TR37.description: The full name of the manufacturer of the transmitter antenna.
TR37.required-when: This field is required when G - Station type is FX and S - Tx channel frequency is greater than 0.
TR37.error-description: The Tx Antenna Manufacturer is missing or exceeds the character limit.

TR38.description: The full name of the manufacturer of the receiver antenna.
TR38.required-when: This field is required when G - Station type is FX and T - Rx channel frequency is greater than 0.
TR38.error-description: The Rx Antenna Manufacturer is missing or exceeds the character limit.

TR39.description: Height (m) of physical centre of the transmitter antenna above or below ground level in meters including the structure/building on which the antenna is mounted.
TR39.required-when: This field is required when S - Tx channel frequency is greater than 0.
TR39.format-rules:
If N - Site Type Code is O (Outdoor):
The antenna height must be between 0 to 600 m and no more than 5 m taller than the O - Structure height.

If N - Site Type Code is I (Indoor):
The antenna height must be between 0 to 600 m.

If N - Site Type Code is U (Underground):
The antenna height must be between -100 to 0 m.
TR39.error-description: The Tx Antenna Height is missing or not within the expected range.

TR40.description: Height (m) of physical centre of the receiver antenna above or below ground level in meters including the structure/building on which the antenna is mounted.
TR40.required-when: This field is required when T - Rx channel frequency is greater than 0.
TR40.format-rules:
If N - Site Type Code is O (Outdoor):
The antenna height must be between 0 to 600 m and no more than 5 m taller than the O - Structure height.

If N - Site Type Code is I (Indoor):
The antenna height must be between 0 to 600 m.

If N - Site Type Code is U (Underground):
The antenna height must be between -100 to 0 m.
TR40.error-description: The Rx Antenna Height is missing or not within the expected range.

TR41.description: Whether the transmitter antenna is omnidirectional or directional.
TR41.required-when: This field is required when S - Tx channel frequency is greater than 0.
TR41.error-description: The Tx Omnidirectional Pattern Indicator is not input as CAPS, is missing or is not an accepted Directional Pattern Code value.
TR41.note:
An error in this field may also give errors for the following fields:
  • AQ - Tx antenna horizontal beamwidth
  • AS - Tx antenna vertical beamwidth
  • AU - Tx antenna azimuth
  • AW - Tx antenna elevation angle

TR42.description: Whether the receiver antenna is omnidirectional or directional.
TR42.required-when: This field is required when T – Rx channel frequency is greater than 0.
TR42.error-description: The Rx Omnidirectional Pattern Indicator is not input as CAPS, is missing or is not an accepted Directional Pattern Code value.
TR42.note:
An error in this field may also give errors for the following fields:
  • AR - Rx antenna horizontal beamwidth
  • AT - Rx antenna vertical beamwidth
  • AV - Rx antenna azimuth
  • AX - Rx antenna elevation angle

TR43.description: The beam steering angle for AAS (Active Antenna Systems) or the beam width in the horizontal plane for non-AAS.
TR43.required-when: This field is required when S - Tx channel frequency is greater than 0 and AO - Tx antenna omnidirectional pattern indicator is D (Directional).
TR43.format-rules:
For AAS
Enter the horizontal beam steering angle range around the mean value specified by AU - Tx Antenna Azimuth.

For non-AAS
Enter the half-power (3 dB) beam width in the horizontal plane of the main lobe for the transmitter antenna.

Must be a number from 1.0 to 359.9 (degrees).
TR43.error-description: The Tx Antenna Horizontal Beamwidth is missing or not within the expected range.

TR44.description: The beam steering angle for AAS (Active Antenna Systems) or the beam width in the horizontal plane for non-AAS.
TR44.required-when: This field is required when T - Rx channel frequency is greater than 0 and AP - Rx antenna omnidirectional pattern indicator is D (Directional).
TR44.format-rules:
For AAS
Enter the horizontal beam steering angle range around the mean value specified by AV - Rx Antenna Azimuth.

For non-AAS
Enter the half-power (3 dB) beam width in the horizontal plane of the main lobe for the receiver antenna.

Must be a number from 1.0 to 359.9 (degrees).
TR44.error-description: The Rx Antenna Horizontal Beamwidth is missing or not within the expected range.

TR45.description: The beam elevation angle for AAS (Active Antenna Systems) or the beam width in the vertical plane for non-AAS.
TR45.required-when: This field is required when S - Tx channel frequency is greater than 0 and AO - Tx antenna omnidirectional pattern indicator is D (Directional).
TR45.format-rules:
For AAS
Enter the vertical beam steering angle range around the mean value specified by AW - Tx Antenna Elevation Angle.

For non-AAS
Enter the half-power (3 dB) beam width in the vertical plane of the main lobe for the transmitter antenna.

Must be a number from 1.0 to 359.9 (degrees).
TR45.error-description: The Tx Antenna Vertical Beamwidth is missing or not within the expected range.

TR46.description: The beam elevation angle for AAS (Active Antenna Systems) or the beam width in the vertical plane for non-AAS.
TR46.required-when: This field is required when T - Rx channel frequency is greater than 0 and AP - Rx antenna omnidirectional pattern indicator is D (Directional).
TR46.format-rules:
For AAS
Enter the vertical beam steering angle range around the mean value specified by AX - Rx Antenna Elevation Angle.

For non-AAS
Enter the half-power (3 dB) beam width in the vertical plane of the main lobe for the receiver antenna.

Must be a number from 1.0 to 359.9 (degrees).
TR46.error-description: The Rx Antenna Vertical Beamwidth is missing or not within the expected range.

TR47.description: The azimuth (in degrees) of the antenna from true north of the transmitter antenna's direction of maximum radiation.
TR47.required-when: This field is required when S - Tx channel frequency is greater than 0 and AO - Tx antenna omnidirectional pattern indicator is D (Directional).
TR47.format-rules: Must be a number from 0.0 to 359.9 (degrees).
TR47.error-description: The Tx Antenna Azimuth is missing or not within the expected range.

TR48.description: The azimuth (in degrees) of the antenna from true north of the receiver antenna's direction of maximum radiation.
TR48.required-when: This field is required when T - Rx channel frequency is greater than 0 and AP - Rx antenna omnidirectional pattern indicator is D (Directional).
TR48.format-rules: Must be a number from 0.0 to 359.9 (degrees).
TR48.error-description: The Rx Antenna Azimuth is missing or not within the expected range.

TR49.description: The transmitter antenna’s vertical elevation angle of the main lobe with reference to the horizontal ground in degrees. Includes any mechanical and electrical beam tilt.
TR49.required-when: This field is required when S - Tx channel frequency is greater than 0 and AO - Tx antenna omnidirectional pattern indicator is D (Directional).
TR49.format-rules: Must be a number from -90.0 to 90.0 (degrees).
TR49.error-description: The Tx Antenna Elevation Angle is missing or not within the expected range.

TR50.description: The receiver antenna’s vertical elevation angle of the main lobe with reference to the horizontal ground in degrees. Includes any mechanical and electrical beam tilt.
TR50.required-when: This field is required when T - Rx channel frequency is greater than 0 and AP - Rx antenna omnidirectional pattern indicator is D (Directional).
TR50.format-rules: Must be a number from -90.0 to 90.0 (degrees).
TR50.error-description: The Rx Antenna Elevation Angle is missing or not within the expected range.

TR51.description: The gain of the transmitter antenna expressed relative to an isotropic radiator (dBi). For AAS, the gain would represent the gain of the individual antenna element.
TR51.required-when: This field is required when S - Tx channel frequency is greater than 0.
TR51.format-rules:
Must be a number from 0.0 to 70.0 (dBi).

For a directional antenna, enter the gain in the direction of maximum radiation.
TR51.error-description: The Tx Antenna Gain is missing or not within the expected range.

TR52.description: The gain of the receiver antenna expressed relative to an isotropic radiator (dBi). For AAS, the gain would represent the gain of the individual antenna element.
TR52.required-when: This field is required when T - Rx channel frequency is greater than 0.
TR52.format-rules:
Must be a number from 0.0 to 70.0 (dBi).

For a directional antenna, enter the gain in the direction of maximum radiation.
TR52.error-description: The Rx Antenna Gain is missing or not within the expected range.

TR53.description: The total of all line, connector and other losses between the radio equipment and transmitter antenna used to calculate the effective isotropic radiated power (EIRP).
TR53.required-when: This field is required when S - Tx channel frequency is greater than 0.
TR53.format-rules: Must be a number from 0.0 to 30.0 (dB).
TR53.error-description: The Tx Line Loss is missing or not within the expected range.

TR54.description: The total of all line, connector and other losses between the radio equipment and receiver antenna used to calculate the effective isotropic radiated power (EIRP).
TR54.required-when: This field is required when T - Rx channel frequency is greater than 0.
TR54.format-rules: Must be a number from 0.0 to 30.0 (dB).
TR54.error-description: The Rx Line Loss is missing or not within the expected range.

fr.page-heading: Text format for spectrum licence site data upload
